snippet: The flow of millions of dollars in private money to extremist fighters has added an unpredictable factor to the war, analysts say, exacerbating divisions in the opposition.
abstract: Flow of millions of dollars in private money from countries like Kuwait to rebel fighters in Syria has added a wild-card factor to the war, exacerbating divisions in the opposition and bolstering its most extreme elements; while West has been hesitant to arm and finance rebels, fighters have flocked to Islamist militias.

byline.contributor: Robert F. Worth contributed reporting from Washington, and Karam Shoumali from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: The flow of millions of dollars in private money to extremist fighters has added an unpredictable factor to the war, analysts say, exacerbating divisions in the opposition.

headline.main: Private Donors’ Funds Add Wild Card to War in Syria
headline.print_headline: Donors’ Funds Add Wild Card to War in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
